subject: Education
title: Performance-Based Assessment: Show What You Can Do
description: A micro-lesson that makes Performance-Based Assessment: Show What You Can Do usable.

hook.text: A driving test doesn't ask you to write an essay about steering. It puts you behind the wheel.

buildup.text: Performance-based assessment requires students to demonstrate skills through real-world tasks.

discovery.text: Authentic tasksâ€”debates, experiments, designsâ€”reveal competencies that written tests cannot measure.

twist.text: Performance assessments are expensive, time-consuming, and harder to score reliably than paper tests.

climax.text: Medical licensing combines both: a written exam and a simulated patient encounter. Neither alone suffices.

punchline.text: The best proof of skill is the skill itself, not a description of it.

quiz.question: Why do some fields combine performance-based and written assessments?
options: Neither type alone captures the full range of knowledge and practical competence
Written tests are legally required in addition to performance tests
